intro: Eriodictyon traskiae subsp. smithii, commonly known as the Smith's yerba santa, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the soapwort family, Geraniaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small, white to pale pink, and are borne in clusters at the base of the plant. This subspecies is notable for its medicinal uses by indigenous peoples, who historically used it for its purported healing properties.
